messages.message: For the pelvis and thorax that appear to be rotating, please give me some advice on rehabilitation.

- Systematically address muscle imbalances and movement inefficiencies
- Design individualized corrective training strategies to restore proper pelvic and thoracic function
- Utilize exercises that focus on inhibition (such as foam rolling), lengthening (static stretching), activation (isolated strengthening), and integration (dynamic multi-joint exercises)
- Incorporate PNF techniques and compound movements for functional stability
- Focus on restoring proper movement patterns and functional stability to the affected areas

What is PNF techniques? How I can combine it with my daily exercise?

- PNF stretching, also known as neuromuscular stretching, involves actively contracting the target muscle before passively stretching it for enhanced flexibility.
- To combine PNF techniques with your daily exercise routine, you can follow these steps:
  - Actively contract the muscle you want to stretch for 7–15 seconds.
  - Then, passively stretch the muscle for 20–30 seconds.
  - Repeat this process one to three times for each muscle group.
  - Make sure to tailor the hold times and intensity based on your individual needs and response to the stretching.
